name: Wisconsin National Guard Tuition Grant (WING)
description: Up to 100% tuition based on UW-Madison rates for Wisconsin National Guard members. NEW 2024: Changed from reimbursement to upfront payment. Maximum of 8 semesters. Online applications only (paper apps ended November 7, 2025).
eligibility: Wisconsin National Guard warrant officer or enlisted in good standing
Enrolled at UW System, Wisconsin Technical College, or reciprocity school
benefit_amount: Up to 100% tuition (based on UW-Madison rates) for 8 semesters
how_to_apply: Apply online only through Wisconsin Department of Military Affairs

name: Wisconsin GI Bill (WI G.I. Bill)
description: Full tuition and segregated fees remission for up to 8 semesters (or 128 credits) at any University of Wisconsin or Wisconsin Technical College for eligible veterans and their dependents.
eligibility: Wisconsin veteran who entered service as WI resident OR lived in WI 5 consecutive years after service
benefit_amount: Full tuition + fees for up to 8 semesters or 128 credits
how_to_apply: Two-step process: WDVA certification then institution approval

name: Veterans Education (VetEd) Grant Program
description: Tuition and fee reimbursement grant based on credit-bank system tied to length of active duty service. For veterans who haven't earned a bachelor's degree. Covers UW, technical colleges, and approved private institutions.
eligibility: Credits available based on service length
benefit_amount: Reimbursement based on credit bank (service length determines credits available)
how_to_apply: Submit completed application to WDVA after successful course completion

name: Veterans and Surviving Spouses Property Tax Credit
description: Refundable property tax credit equal to the FULL AMOUNT of property taxes paid on primary residence for 100% disabled veterans and unremarried surviving spouses receiving DIC. Claimed on Wisconsin income tax return.
eligibility: OR unremarried surviving spouse receiving DIC
Wisconsin resident (5 years after service OR entered from WI)
benefit_amount: 100% refund of property taxes paid on primary residence
how_to_apply: Obtain WDVA verification, attach to first year WI tax return, then automatic

name: Veteran Job Retraining Grants
description: Up to $3,000 per year for maximum of 2 years ($6,000 total) for recently unemployed or underemployed veterans with financial need while being retrained for employment.
benefit_amount: $3,000/year x 2 years maximum ($6,000 total)
how_to_apply: Apply through WDVA with financial need documentation

name: Military Retirement Pay Tax Exemption
description: All military retirement pay (including SBP and RSFPP) is completely exempt from Wisconsin state income tax.
benefit_amount: 100% exemption on all military retirement income
how_to_apply: Exclude from Wisconsin income tax return

name: Combat Pay and Hazardous Duty Pay Tax Exemption
description: Military pay exempt from federal taxes (combat pay, hazardous duty, hostile fire pay) is also exempt from Wisconsin state income tax.
benefit_amount: 100% exemption on combat and hazardous duty pay
how_to_apply: Exclude from Wisconsin income tax return (follows federal exclusion)

name: National Guard/Reserve Active Duty Pay Exemption
description: Military pay for National Guard/Reserve members called to federal active duty or special state service is NOT taxed in Wisconsin. Does not apply to drill pay or annual training.
eligibility: Called to federal active duty or state service
benefit_amount: 100% exemption on active duty pay (not drill/training)
how_to_apply: Exclude qualifying pay from Wisconsin tax return

name: Death Gratuity Tax Exemption
description: DoD Death Gratuity paid to surviving dependent of active duty service member killed in line of duty is exempt from Wisconsin income tax.
eligibility: Surviving dependent of service member KIA
benefit_amount: 100% exemption on death gratuity payment
how_to_apply: Exclude from Wisconsin income tax return

name: Veterans Employment Preference
description: Veterans hiring preference for Wisconsin state government positions. Additional points awarded on civil service exams.
benefit_amount: Point preference on state employment exams
how_to_apply: Indicate veteran status on state job applications with DD-214

name: Disabled Veteran Reduced-Fee Fishing License
description: Wisconsin disabled veterans with 70% or greater service-connected disability rating are eligible for reduced-fee fishing license. Must be renewed annually.
benefit_amount: Reduced-fee fishing license (annual)
how_to_apply: Apply at DNR or County Clerk office with VA disability letter

name: Free Hunting and Fishing on Leave
description: Wisconsin resident service members on active duty leave get FREE small game hunting and fishing licenses. Also eligible for bonus antlerless deer authorization.
eligibility: Must show military ID and leave papers
benefit_amount: FREE hunting and fishing licenses + bonus deer tag while on leave
how_to_apply: Show military ID and leave papers when applying

name: Free State Park Admission
description: Free admission to Wisconsin state parks and trails for disabled veterans (70%+ disability) and former POWs. Fee waivers for vehicle admission and trail passes.
eligibility: Wisconsin resident veteran with 70%+ disability OR former POW
benefit_amount: FREE admission to all WI state parks and trails
how_to_apply: Obtain waiver from Wisconsin Parks and Recreation

name: Assistance to Needy Veterans Grant (ANVG)
description: Limited financial assistance for veterans in need who have exhausted all other aid sources. Grants for specified healthcare and subsistence needs up to maximum grant limits.
benefit_amount: Grants vary by need - up to program maximum limits
how_to_apply: Contact County Veterans Service Officer (CVSO)

name: Emergency Financial Assistance for Military Families
description: Financial assistance for families of activated or deployed service members and unremarried surviving spouses/dependent children of veterans who died in line of duty during active or inactive training.
eligibility: Family of activated/deployed Wisconsin service member
OR unremarried surviving spouse/dependent of KIA veteran
benefit_amount: Emergency grants for immediate needs
how_to_apply: Contact Wisconsin Department of Veterans Affairs

name: Wisconsin Veterans Homes
description: Three state veterans homes providing 24-hour skilled nursing care. Located at Northern WI (Spooner), Central WI (King), and Southern WI (Union Grove). Federal assistance accepted where applicable.
eligibility: Priority for wartime veterans and service-connected disabled
benefit_amount: Subsidized skilled nursing care (rates vary by income)
how_to_apply: Contact Wisconsin Department of Veterans Affairs for admission

name: WDVA Home Loan Program
description: Three loan types: Home Loan, Home Improvement Loan, and Personal Loan. Standard underwriting with competitive rates. Funded by bond sales or Veterans Trust Fund cash reserves.
benefit_amount: Below-market rates on home, improvement, and personal loans
how_to_apply: Apply through Wisconsin Department of Veterans Affairs

name: Military Funeral Honors Program
description: Final military tribute for veterans administered by WDVA with assistance from VSOs, CVSOs, funeral directors, and military forces. Provides dignified and solemn ceremony.
benefit_amount: Military funeral honors ceremony at no cost
how_to_apply: Arrange through funeral director who coordinates with WDVA

name: Wisconsin State Veterans Cemeteries
description: Three state-operated veterans cemeteries: Northern Wisconsin (Spooner), Central Wisconsin (King), and Southern Wisconsin (Union Grove). Veterans buried at no cost upon meeting eligibility. Spouses and dependent children may be buried with fee.
eligibility: Wisconsin resident OR died while WI resident
Spouses and dependents eligible with fee
benefit_amount: FREE burial for veterans; fee for spouses/dependents
how_to_apply: Contact WDVA for pre-need or at-need applications

name: Veteran License Plates
description: Special veteran license plates available for Wisconsin veterans. Various designs available including disabled veteran plates and branch-specific plates.
benefit_amount: Special veteran license plates (fees vary by type)
how_to_apply: Apply through Wisconsin DMV with DD-214
